Replies.Reply: Written like this. One word.
eXistenZ. It's new, it's from Antenna Research, and it's here, right now.
My name is Wittold Levi, my friends call me Witt - and I'm the project manager for eXistenZ.
tonight, it won't be me. No, for the test launch of eXistenZ by Antenna, we have brought you a seminar leader who is rather special.
Yes, it is. The world's greatest game designer is here, in person, to lead you, the first test enclave, through her newest creation, eXistenZ by Antenna...
I give you, the Game-Pod Goddess herself - Allegra Geller!
MetaFlesh.
Written like this. One word.
.we call an UmbyCord. Spelled like this.
I guess you can tell I started off as a schoolteacher.
Are the MetaFlesh Game-Pods by Antenna Research ready?
And how many of these precious prototypes did we manage to bring with us?
Twenty-one? I thought we had an even two dozen.
Really? Any chance that some of the others...?
God-damn better be.

We have twenty-one prototype MetaFlesh Game-Pods, and that means that for our first wave test enclave we need twenty-one volunteers who will port in these slave units with the Game-Pod Goddess herself...
Everything's in order. Are you ready, Allegra?
She spends most of her time alone in a room designing her games. I think she'd like it best if she never had to show them to anybody.
She hates having to port in with her fans. It's too intimate.
We make her do it.
Are you with us or did an independent security company send you?
Well, for example, we've spent a fortune developing eXistenZ, but we all know it's a risky project.
eXistenZ is a lot more than a game.

And we're worried that it's too intellectual, too complex, too weird, too artsy. That argument ; never bothers her until she faces her fans. She hates to be rejected in the flesh, so we make her come out sometimes to take the heat.
It's the new Antenna Research theme song. We thought this would be a good way to launch it.
Get her out of here! Save her!
We have enemies in our own house.
But you were so wonderfully bad.
The world of games is in a kind of a trance. People are programmed to accept so little, but the possibilities are so great.
You probably thought that tonight, we were going to test a new game that I designed.
But there is no new game to test, at least, not in the usual sense.
No, no, it's going to be much better than you expected, because eXistenZ is not just a game. It's an entirely new game system.
Sure. This is my favourite part.
I'm ready to download eXistenZ by Antenna Research into you all now. I'm warning you, it's going to be a wild ride, but don't panic no matter what happens.
Am I? With you?
I can't lose this! I can't lose this!
Let's take my limo.
Why no?
You drive, idiot!
We need this vehicle, and we need it without you. But with the keys.
Get out, Frances. You can say you were hijacked.
Thanks, Frances.
Only if you don't really know what's going on.
There is great stress and anger and violence in the countryside.
up spending a lot of time here.
Sure. If you go back home to the city, they'll probably be waiting for you.
Yeah. My assassins. They'd want to have a little talk with you about where I am.
Did you hear the way he screamed at me? He wasn't alone.
Not country people. Games people.
The city's full of bad microwaves, bad thermals, bad electro-optics. You can't shield from it anymore. You can't get true readings. The whole industry moved out of the city years ago.
Maybe. But it seems I have some enemies I didn't know I had.
You're labelled.
It has a trigger. I pulled it.
Later. I think I'm gonna use it in my next game. If there ever is a next game.
What's that?
Answer it.
That was a rangefinder. As long as you have that, they know where you are.
I mean anybody.
I heard what Levi said to you. He said, "We have enemies in our own house." He said it as he was dying.
Anti-existentialists?
Yeah.
I hear things. It's hard to surprise me.
And what else?
Pikul, why don't you have a gun with you?
You're not armed. They told me you were my security but you have no weaponry.
Fuck. I'm marked for death and they send me on the road with a PR nerd.
Don't sweat it, Pikul. I'll handle it. We just have to disappear for a while. And right now, we have to stop.
So we can have an intimate moment together.
C'mon. If you're gonna do it, do it.
What do you mean?
Lemme see that weirdo pistol.
Yep. The bullets are human teeth.
I suppose the smaller caliber pistols would have to fire baby teeth. The tooth fairy could go I into the arms business.
The whole gamesworld is in a kind of trance.
expectations. They have no idea what amazing things could be theirs.
I was wandering through eXistenZ - the new system, I mean.
I like it in there. Of course, without another player you're only a tourist. It's frustrating.
Where's your bioport? Don't tell me you were never fitted. I can't believe it.
what a genius I am.
Bullshit. Posturing. You don't play my games, you don't work for Antenna Research, I'll make sure of that.
I'm not so sure I do.
God, c'mon. They just pop your spine with a little hydro-gun.
It's your chosen profession, geek.

There's an intimacy involved in playing eXistenZ that is beyond description. It has to be experienced. And frankly, the two-player version is the most exquisitely intense. Wouldn't you like to play with me?
They wouldn't want to talk to you if they knew you had never had a bioport installed. It's company policy, you know. They want you to be passionate about your work.
Besides, once you're ported, there's no end to the games you can play.
My baby here took a huge hit in the church, Pikul. You see how she's quivering?
out just as the game architecture was being downloaded from her to all those slave pods... that's a very vulnerable time for her. She could be crying out for help right here, right now.

The only way I can tell if everything's OK - the game's not been contaminated, the pod, my baby, is not about to be crippled for life because of my negligence - the only way is to play eXistenZ with somebody friendly.
Well, Gas, you could check your bioport-plugs.
You heard me. My friend here has a bioport problem.
Sure you do.
What's going on, Gas?

This is it, you see. This is the cage I was talking about, the cage of your own making which keeps you trapped and pacing about in the smallest possible space forever. Break out of your cage, Pikul. Break out now.
That swelling doesn't last for long. Tomorrow, you won't even notice it.
We don't have to wait for the swelling to go down.
You wanted to play my game, didn't you?
It's an instant-on world, isn't it?
New ports are sometimes a bit tight. Wouldn't want to hurt you.
Listen to what you're saying, Pikul. Don't be ludicrous.
Maybe afterwards.
Shit, Pikul! I can't believe this! I trusted you and you blew my pod! You must have neural-
I jacked you into my pod and you obviously panicked. Now it's totally fucked! This is a disaster!
I was forced to trust you and you panicked and you neural-surged, and you blew my pod.

Pikul, in this pod is the only, the original version of eXistenZ, an entire game system that cost thirty-eight million to develop, not including pre-release marketing costs. And I'm locked outside of my own game! I can't get it out, or me in!
Security is everything these days. It's the only one and its stuck inside and it's your fault.
I've devoted my five most passionate years to this strange little creature. And I've never regretted it, Pikul, because I knew that it was the only thing that could give my life any meaning...
Oh, no, Gas, not you.
What's going on?
But can you kill a person? Can you do that, Gas? Can you kill me? Hide my body. Contact the crazies. Trust them to pay up.
You did distract him.
Plug your toaster into that hole, corpse!
Yep.
I've never been more popular.
You're right. I've got to get this pod fixed.
Nothing in the countryside is what it seems. It's all appearance versus reality, and the reality here is something unique.
Nobody actually physically skis any more, Pikul. You know that.
Yeah, right.
Kiri Vinokur, this is my bodyguard, Ted Pikul.
There have been a couple of attempts on my life already.
I don't know if they can do anything about it. It seems to be open season on me.
Kiri, no, don't. You mustn't let anybody know we're here unless you have to. I can't be sure that Antenna is completely safe for me.
.and make sure I don't lose everything I have in here.
Pikul's bioport.
He's not kidding. He's a total PR nerd.
It ports into you, and you are the power source. Your body, your nervous system. Your energy. When you get tired, run down, it won't run properly.
It's not infected. It's just excited. It wants action.

My baby here has now taken three major hits, one in the church, one in the gas station, and one on the operating table. The only way I can tell if everything's OK - the game's not been contaminated, the pod's not fucked - is to play eXistenZ with somebody friendly. Are you friendly, or are you not?
That's how they work. See? You're hummin' along already.
All right. eXistenZ. Only from Antenna. Here we go.
You could beat the guy who invented poker, couldn't you?
Depends on the style of the game.
It's basically a game store I used to hang out in as a kid.

We're ported into a game-pod together, remember? eXistenZ has complete access to both our central nervous systems. Its game architecture will be based on our memories, our anxieties, our preoccupations...
You keep saying that.
The beauty of eXistenZ is that it changes every time you play it.
Not at all. It's a much more organic approach to gaming than classic, arbitrary, rule-
Will it work with an industry standard bioport?
We're just looking.
It's your character who said it.
Look at him.
He's gone into a game loop, he's locked up, and he won't come out of it until you give him a proper game line of dialogue.
Start by repeating your last line. Include his name so he knows you're talking.to him.
Yes, of course, that's right. We both have bioports.
We do, don't we?
We'd better check.
I see what you mean.
Yes, we both have bioports.
Yeah. Kinda disappointing.
Yeah. Not a very well-drawn character. And his dialogue was just so-so.
The game engine is just getting used to us. It'll get more daring once it warms up.
OK. The pods are so small they plug directly into the bioport.
God!
The whole pod just disappeared into your back.
Don't panic, it's just a game. Do you feel anything yet?
What the hell was that?
You're right. Our characters are obviously supposed to jump on each other. Probably to create emotional tension when danger happens. No use fighting it.
They'll take care of themselves.
Your what?
They're just where we left them, sitting quietly, eyes closed.
Don't sweat it. All your senses are still operating. You'll pop right out of the game if there's a problem.
I guess.
I don't know. You have to understand that, to understand what we've really created with eXistenZ.
Correct. I don't.
We ordered it because another game character told you to.
Sure, yeah, but why? What's wrong? Aren't you dying to see what's special about the special?
That's a great sign. It means your nervous system is fully engaging with the game architecture. The game is a lot more fun when it starts to feel realer than real.
So how does it feel?
Your real life. The one you came back for.
You're stuck now, aren't you? You want to go back to the Chinese restaurant because there's nothing happening here. We're safe. It's boring.
Definitely not.
Our characters did. I'm sure it would be very different if we did.
No. In real life I tend to lose control. It can get messy.
Let's go back.
No, it looks terrific. Thank you.
Pikul, what are you doing?
Oh, good!
Yeah. It's a genuine game urge.
It should be OK.
Do you have that bridge in real life?
It probably wasn't until you ordered the special.
That's not funny!
Who?
Oh, well, that makes sense.
Waiter! Waiter!
When he comes over, do it. Don't hesitate.
You won't be able to stop. You might as well enjoy it.
It's like real life - there's just enough to make it interesting.
Through the kitchen! That way!
Why did the Chinese waiter have to die?
The Trout Farm is owned by Cortical Systematics?
Where did that come from?
I'm impressed.
I wouldn't take it too seriously.
We saw it everywhere in Dorsey Nader's game store, remember?
That's probably fair to say.
We're just characters in here.
I'm looking for Dorsey Nader. Is he here?
Is Dorsey Nader here?
What happened?
You're with the Realist underground.
Are you trying to talk us into having them removed?
I don't understand. Are you wanting us to jack a game into our bioports?
Come on in.
Thanks so much, Kiri. This is very sweet of you.
Has what?
Oh, yes, sure. That's why we're so spaced out.
We were right into it, weren't we?
Kiri?
Have you heard anything yet? I mean, about the eXistenZ test seminar and the shooting?
What? Tell me.
Support for the fanatics? What does that mean?
Who is?
Not yet, Kiri. Thanks.
Sounds like you might approve of that.
Are you kidding?
We can't stop. I've been noticing some new... glitches. I'm not sure what they mean. I'm not sure the game is OK.
Yeah, I love it.
When eXistenZ is released, it's gonna wipe the competition off the face of the earth.
It really will do that, yes.
Don't hurt me, Pikul. Don't make me go back in alone. Play with me.
But you have one now. And you're ported in.
It wasn't cruel, it was desperate. C'mon, Pikul. You've just got a bad case of first-time user anxiety.
That sounds like my game, all right.
But it's a game that everybody's already playing! Existence, it's wonderful!
My assembly bay.
I'd say it's exactly as advertised.
I have a terrible urge to port into it. What about you?
Here we go. Wanna give me a hand?
Exactly. Help me.
No time at all.
Oh, God!
0, God, don't! That really hurts!
No, don't, I'm afraid!
Pikul. It's here, it's happened.
We brought the disease back with us. My pod is diseased.
Oh God, I'm really going to lose it, I'm going to lose my game!
I'm coming, I'm coming!
There's a very weird reality-
It's an anti-viral serum. It sometimes works if you get it in time.
Lemme see your bioport.
Lemme see it!
I know what happened. It's Vinokur, that bastard.
He gave you a new bioport, didn't he?
He gave you an infected bioport so that my pod would die and so would my game-system.
The poor thing was trying to tell us that it was sick by introducing the theme of disease into our game.
All right, don't panic. I've got something that will help you.
I'm going to seal up your bioport with this anti-viral resonator.
It uses the Umby pick-ups for power. Should cleanse all your porting channels of infection in a few hours. It'11 give you a little skin buzz when it's done.
Oh, God! Pikul, my pod's dying.
I can't help it! I can't do anything for it!
I don't know! I don't know!
But my game! My game's inside it.
The death of eXistenZ. And we were part of it.
You didn't get here in time. My game is dead.
You murdered my game.
You copied eXistenZ?
You're a spy for Cortical Systematics.
Only from Antenna Research.
You know, this guy was actually going to kill me.
C'mon, Pikul. He's only a game character. And I didn't like the way he was messing with my mind.
He was only a game character.
Huh? If... if we... we're not?
Why?
Not an accident?
That's why you never had a bioport. You were one of them.
But you have a bioport now.
I thought that was forbidden to Anti-eXistenZialists.
Why would you do that?
Then. understand this.

Understand that I suspected who you were from the moment you made that fake phone call to yourself in the limo. Understand that I knew you were my real assassin when you pointed the gun at me in the Chinese restaurant.
And understand that you're dead.
Death to the demon Ted Pikul!
Have I won the game? Have I won?
I'd just like to say thank you to Mr. Nourish for giving me the chance to play the role of a star designer. I guess the game picked up on my ambitions to be like you.
I guess you all could tell that Ted and I had a relationship prior to our coming here. We really do like to play together.
Yevgeny, don't you think you should suffer for all the harm you've done, and intend to do, to the human race?
Death to the demon Yevgeny Nourish!
Death to PilgrImage! Death to TranscendenZ!
What?
Yes, Mr; Levi.
Twenty-one, Mr. Levi.
We think we're clean.
How long were we gone?
Yeah. If you stayed in the gameworld for most of your life, you could live to be five hundred years old!
The first three we opened were...
Hold it. Not so fast.
It's just the first wave. You can be part of the second wave.
OK, Joel Dichter. Put your arms up. I have to scan you. Metal and heavy synthetics can't come in.
More for recording devices. Lotta money invested in these games.
You won't need it tonight.
This is where the real people live, Joel. Her real fans, like you.
She seems to be very shy. It never occurred to me that a big star would be shy.
Really? She doesn't enjoy all the adulation?
Then why does she do it?
By "we" you mean, the game company, Antenna Research?
Why?
Me? Oh, I'm with your own management training program.
I want to end up in marketing and public relations.
The only thing I know about security is how to switch this thing on.
A problem with her new game?
Yeah, right, it's a game system.
4 I've heard that she's very sensitive.
What are they doing?
Catchy.
No! Don't do it!
Me? Me take her?
She's coming with me! I'm responsible for her! She's supposed to come with me!
Yeah, you're coming with me.
No, no!
I don't trust the driver!
I normally like the countryside, don't you? Normally, the country is relaxing and calm.
What do you mean?
Well, I like the countryside.
I might?
They?
I was hoping that was just one crazy guy.
Everybody likes a conspiracy.
Well, what are we going to do out here? Do you know your way around? You know any country people?
That's weird. I never knew that.
So you know your way around. We can hide out.
Wow.
Oh. Yeah.
How did you know how to fire that, gun? I've never seen anything like it.
Can I see it?
Migod, you're bleeding. I forgot you got hit.
It's my pink-fone. I'm not sure I should answer it.
Ted Pikul.
What happened? Some fan went crazy and started shooting up the place. I don't know why. He was just nuts. Allegra Geller? She's with me. We're OK. Yeah. Yeah.
You're kidding me. You're kidding me! God. 1 can't believe it. I can't do that. No, how can I do that? Well, I'm not really sure where we are because...
What? Can I have my pink-tone back?
What did you do that for? That was our lifeline to civilization.
They? You mean head office?
I don't think he died. I mean, do you? I think he maybe fainted...
That was Alex Kindred, head of publicity and marketing, at Antenna HQ...
.on that very expensive pink-

No. Anti-eXistenZialists. Capital X, capital Z. They somehow found out about eXistenZ and they want to kill you for creating it. They say that the eXistenZ game system will "finally destroy reality", or something totally nuts like that.
It makes sense to you? You're not suprised?
Kindred said that I'm your bodyguard and the company is holding me totally responsible for your safety.
What?
Who told you that? I'm just a marketing trainee. My clinic master thought I'd learn something about marketing if I moonlighted as a security guard on one of your test previews.
Jesus! Marked for death!
We do? Why?
OK, OK.
I got it. Wow. Did somebody bite you?
What I just dug out of you. It's a tooth. A human tooth.
That thing was designed to get past any kind of metal or synthetics detector. It's all flesh and bone.
That guy really came there tonight just to kill you.
Amazing, isn't it?
Yes. I remember you said that at the church.
Where were you just now? What were you doing?

Why won't you let me contact Antenna? They've got to be going crazy, wondering what's happened to you. I mean, it's not like we've done something wrong. We just ran because we didn't know how many of them there were, right? I think we owe it to Antenna to let them know you're all right, to get them to send somebody to help you who knows what he's doing... And besides, I can't... I can't just keep doing this, whatever it is, you know, forever, not having any idea when it's going to be...
Hey, what are you doing?
No, I was never fitted with a bioport. What do you care?
My clinic master told me I don't need to play a game to know how to sell it.
Look, I've been dying to play your games. But I have this -
Getting a bioport fitted... I dunno. I can't do it. It's too freaky. Makes my skin crawl.
Yeah, sure. With only an infinitesimal chance of permanent spinal paralysis. I've read all about it.
Well, yeah, of course, but... Let me, uh, let me call Antenna...
You can't seriously want to play games now. Not here. Not while we're being hunted down by crazy people. _ Geller sighs, then switches into her explaining-the-facts-
It... she, yes, she's quivering.
Sure, all right.
Let's do it... let's do it now.
Replies.Didascalie: (he might have found a way  OUT)

Replies.Reply: What was your life like before?
Before it was changed by Allegra Geller.
But you still operate a gas station, don't you?
Liberated?
I don't have a bioport, remember?
Those are sterile, are they?
Then why the clean overalls?
Oh, God.
Never say dye.
I didn't expect that to hurt. I expect the next part to hurt.
Yeah, that's what I expect will hurt.
How many have you done?
Yeah. All two of them.
I love it. Great.
What's going on? I can't walk!
You're looking more like a butcher than a mechanic.
What are you doing?
You're going to port into me?
Yeah, I did, and I do, but...
What's that for? It feels cold.
How come bioports don't get infected? I mean, they open right into your body...
Don't you think you could call me Ted?
What do you mean?
I.. I was nervous, but I didn't panic.
You can get a new pod...
Are you serious? This is the only version that exists?
But why is it my fault? I'm telling you, I didn't, I did not neural-surge. I didn't. I didn't feel any surging.
What are you talking about?
But, but... she changed your life.
But wait... Why did you install a bad port into me?
Oh, God, I think he's dead. I thought I could just distract him.
He wanted to kill you.
That's two people in one day who wanted to actually kill you.
Allegra, we need help.
We're going skiing?
Look at that huge bug. It's got two heads.
What if somebody comes up here and really wants to ski?
I've watched some ski shows.
If I'm her bodyguard, then she's in grave danger.
It was a flawed installation - my first. It... it neural-surged.
Nerve boards?
Wow. And where do the batteries go?
It hurts. I think it's infected.
But I really don't think that I want action. Me, I mean. The bearer of the excited bioport.
You're telling me this thing will run off my body's energy?
You've got a bit of an unfair advantage, don't you? How can I possibly compete with the designer of the system?
That was beautiful. I feel...
This is amazing. I had no idea.
Are you serious?
Are you serious?
Wait a minute. That reminds me.
But that's kind of cheating, isn't it? Not to say confusing.
Look at this. Could this be the future too?
Yes. I can imagine.
You do?
It's none of your businesz who sent us. We're here, and that's all that matters.
Oh God, what happened? I didn't mean to say that!
But should you be saying that in front of him? Nader?
What's he doing?
This is tricky.
We're here, Dorsey Nader, and that's all that matters.
Well, Nader, you said you had what we want. We're waiting.
I assumed we did. I mean, here.
Yeah, it's there. Looks a little different, but it's there.
I assume that Nader is our entry point into the game.
Nader?
Yeah.
Do we blame ourselves for that?
What happened?
It disappeared into my back?!
No, I don't. Not a thing. I don't feel a thing. Uh, do you want me to do you?
That wasn't me. That was my game character. I wouldn't have done that. Not here, anyway.
What about our new identities? Do you feel yours yet?
I'm very worried about my body.
I mean, where are our real bodies? Are they all right? Are they hungry? What if there's danger?
I don't know. I feel really vulnerable. Disembodied.
Yes. I... I'm... very new. Did you say trout farm?
It surprises me more than it surprises you.
I, ah... I've been trained by the very best.
I'm new here. I have no plans for lunch.
Won't you be going there too?
All right, I'll do that.
Yes?
What's that mean?
Should I just get up and go there?
I order the special.
He told me where to have lunch.
We want the special.
Did you hear me, Chinese waiter?
We want the special.
But this is a special occasion.
It's her birthday.
I guess the special isn't very popular.
But you know, really, don't you?
You're telling me, for example, that you don't know what the special is?
Or why we ordered it.
I want to put the game on pause.
The game can be paused, can't it?

I'm feeling a little disconnected from my real life. I'm kind of losing touch with the texture of it, you know what I mean? I mean, I actually think there's an element of psychosis involved here. I mean, I don't know where my body really is, or where reality is, what I've actually done, or not done.
Yeah.
eXistenZ is paused!
Did I do that? I guess I did.
What?
Just sitting here, it feels completely unreal. I'm sure you knew that would happen.
Worse than that. I'm not sure here, where we are, is real at all. This feels like the game.
Did we really make love to each other?
It feels like we did.
I... I'm actually just like that in real life. You got the real Ted Pikul there, in the stockroom of the game store.
I didn't?
I think I've lost my appetite.
I don't know. I find this disgusting but I can't help myself.
Good? You think this is good?
I am fighting it, but it isn't doing me any good.
Omigod, this looks awfully familiar. You sure this is OK?
Absolutely not. My teeth are perfect. Don't ask me how I knew this thing was in my mouth.
Death to the demoness Allegra Geller.
Sorry, I couldn't resist. But you know... I do feel the urge to kill someone here.
I need to kill our waiter.
But everything in this game is so realistic. I don't think I really could...
"Free will" is obviously not a big factor in this little world of ours.
He's too nice. I won't do it.
I found this in my soup and I'm very upset.
St's all right, just a little misunderstanding over the check.
I feel a serious game urge to get out of here!
Yes. It was very... revealing.
He betrayed you?
Is that where you caught today's special?

Reality is a fragile thing. Most people think that reality must of course be the most solid thing, but it isn't. Reality is threatened now more than ever. It is being eroded and it is washing away in the deforming storm of non-reality, which masquerades as reality, and eventually replaces it. Deformed and crippled and limping and hideous, threatening to engulf us all.
The game made me do it.
"Enemies of Reality"? Or does it really mean, enemies of eXistenZ?
Yes. So that makes it the game-

So, then, do we meekly go back to work and say nothing? It sounds as though Nourish and his Realists are preparing to sabotage the Trout Farm. Before you know it, they'll be planning to assassinate game designers.
Then what do we do next?
Migod!
Why not?
But we were contacted there by Yevgeny Nourish. He seemed to know exactly who we were.
If Nourish isn't our real contact, who is he?
We are?
We do.
How will we know what to do?
Yeah, we were. And it's amazing.
What is that you've brought?
Your friend Vinokur is getting shaky. I think he's going to turn, you in to Antenna.
It might be the safest thing. Are you hungry?
